ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about working with different materials to make beautiful pieces of art. Also a create introduction to learn the language and process of "critiques," especially as a non-art major.
I learned about different sculpture techniques/
I learned how to sculpt with foam, plaster, and wood
Learnt how to use particular materials including plaster and styrofoam to create various sculptures and basic forms

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Very chill environment, Prof. Burns is very amiable and understands each student on an individual level
Weaknesses: Sometimes I feel like Prof. Burns was a little too chill, in terms that a lot of students would show up 30 minutes late or not show up some weeks at all, and she would not really say anything.

We spend a long time doing demos and really only completed one project which was the final project. Everything else was mainly experimenting- which I also like but I think we could have had more assignments.

I really enjoyed the flexibility that we had ti pursue the ideas that interested us. The class could be slightly more structured, but, as a senior, the unstructured nature and fluidity worked well for me.

- accessible to non art majors
- structured demos with a freedom to use the acquired skills in a personally interesting and relevant way 
- emphasizes and celebrates experimentation

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, great introduction to sculpture but also the art world in general. There is a massive difference between those who observe art and those who create it, and this course is a great way to get an idea of how to do both better.
Yes, I learned a lot about different useful processes.
Absolutely! Sandra and Younes were both amazing and were great at balancing technical demos with the needs/interests of the class

Yes, I would! I had a great time learning under Professor Burns. They were really understanding and encouraging, and really pushed us to think outside the box. This is a class that I didn't need for my major, but it gave me a new perspective on different materials and allowed me to think in a new way. I also really appreciated the feedback and encouragement given by our TA Younes!
Would definitely recommend!! This is the first art class I have taken at Yale and it did not disappoint. Despite the different backgrounds and skillsets of students in the class everyone benefitted.
